content: The 22‑year‑old right‑hand‑dominant male sustained a left index finger crush injury at approximately 8:15 when a camping trunk hinge opened onto his hand. He experienced immediate pain with motion but noted no obvious deformity or angulation. He presented to the emergency department where X‑rays confirmed a fracture and he received irrigation and interrupted sutures for two dorsal lacerations along the ulnar border and second web space. He reports limited flexion and extension of the middle finger but is able to actively flex. He is currently using a cast and soft dressing.
title: HPI Spencer

content: There's no deformity or angulation. No apparent mal rotation of the index finger. Limited flexion and extension of the middle finger at the empty point so he is actively able to flex. the hand demonstrated minimally displaced rash and the small.
